page.title: 20WALKING THE " PENNINE WAY"
page.content: In the North_Eastern section of our block runs part of the "Pennine Way". This was the first of the country's long distance footpaths. It runs, uninterupted, from the Peak District of Derbyshire in the South, to the Cheviots in the North. In our block it peaks at Windy Hill (991133), at a height of 466m. The name of the hill is very apt, for even on Summer's days it can be very wild; and is a reminder to any one that the moorlands are not to be treated without respect. Access to the Pennine way in our block can be obtained by leaving the M62 at exit 22 and travelling south on the A672 for approximately half a mile. {BLOCK SURVEYED BY:_J.M.HEALEY AND {ST.JAMES'C.OF E. PRIMARY AND {S.TUNNICLIFFE AND ST.THOMAS' C.OF E. }
